concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of making instance variables and methods private to hide internal class details from other classes.

concepts.name: Principle Of Least Knowledge
concepts.description: A design principle that minimizes dependencies by limiting what classes know about each other's internal workings.

concepts.name: Loose Coupling
concepts.description: A design approach where classes have minimal dependencies on each other to reduce the impact of changes.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The object-oriented programming concept of bundling data and methods together while hiding implementation details.

concepts.name: Instance Variables
concepts.description: Class variables that represent the state of an object and should typically be kept private.

concepts.name: Class Dependencies
concepts.description: The relationships between classes where changes in one class may require changes in dependent classes.

concepts.name: Public Interface
concepts.description: The set of public methods and properties that a class exposes for other classes to use.

concepts.name: Object State
concepts.description: The current condition of an object at runtime, characterized by the values of its instance variables.

concepts.name: Runtime Behavior
concepts.description: The actions and operations an object can perform, typically implemented through its methods.

concepts.name: Design Principles
concepts.description: Fundamental guidelines that serve as the foundation for creating well-structured software architectures.

concepts.name: Design Patterns
concepts.description: Reusable models that provide proven solutions to common software architecture problems.

concepts.name: Instance Variables
concepts.description: Variables that characterize an object at runtime with unique values that define the object's state.

concepts.name: Runtime Behavior
concepts.description: The actions and operations an object can perform, represented by a class's methods during program execution.

concepts.name: Class Implementation
concepts.description: The specific way instance variables and methods are coded within a class to provide its functionality.

concepts.name: Private Attributes
concepts.description: Instance variables that are hidden from external access and should only be used within the defining class.

concepts.name: Public Interface
concepts.description: The exposed methods and properties that allow external classes to interact with an object without knowing its implementation.

concepts.name: Principle Of Least Knowledge
concepts.description: A design principle stating that classes should know as little as possible about each other's implementation details.

concepts.name: Law Of Demeter
concepts.description: An alternative name for the Principle of Least Knowledge, emphasizing loose coupling between software components.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal class details from external access while providing necessary public interfaces.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The bundling of data and methods within a class while controlling access to the internal implementation.

concepts.name: Helper Methods
concepts.description: Private methods within a class that are designed to be called only by other methods of the same class.

concepts.name: Loose Coupling
concepts.description: A design approach where classes have minimal dependencies on each other's internal implementations.

concepts.name: Class Dependencies
concepts.description: The relationships and reliances that exist between different classes in a software system.

concepts.name: Python Naming Convention
concepts.description: The practice of using underscore prefixes to indicate private variables and methods in Python classes.

concepts.name: Hidden Implementation
concepts.description: Code that is inaccessible and encapsulated, meaning it can be changed without affecting other code that uses the class.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The practice of making implementation code effectively hidden and protected from external access.

concepts.name: Privacy Convention
concepts.description: Python's naming convention where variables or methods starting with underscore are intended to be private implementation details.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variable
concepts.description: Class variables intended to be hidden from external access, typically prefixed with underscore in Python.

concepts.name: Getter And Setter Methods
concepts.description: Public methods that provide controlled access to hidden implementation details, also known as accessors and mutators.

concepts.name: Public Interface
concepts.description: The parts of a class that are intentionally exposed for other code to use and interact with.

concepts.name: Once Public Always Public
concepts.description: The principle that making something public in a class interface creates a commitment that's difficult to change later.

concepts.name: Property Decorator
concepts.description: Python's @property decorator mechanism for creating read-only properties and associating getter methods.

concepts.name: Access Control Design
concepts.description: The design principle of making everything private by default except what must be public for the class to function.

concepts.name: Implementation Dependency
concepts.description: The problematic situation where external code relies on specific internal implementation details of a class.

concepts.name: Property Decorator
concepts.description: A Python decorator that creates a read-only property and associates a getter method with it.

concepts.name: Property Setter
concepts.description: A decorator that associates a setter method with a property to set new values for private instance variables.

concepts.name: Getter Method
concepts.description: A method that allows code to access an object's current state without revealing the implementation details.

concepts.name: Setter Method
concepts.description: A method that allows code to modify an object's state while potentially validating new values and hiding implementation.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variable
concepts.description: An internal variable (prefixed with underscore) that stores object state and should not be accessed directly.

concepts.name: Property Object
concepts.description: An object created by the property decorator that simplifies code and provides controlled access to attributes.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal implementation details while providing controlled access through public interfaces.

concepts.name: Public Properties
concepts.description: Class attributes that are meant to be used by external code instead of directly accessing private variables.

concepts.name: Value Validation
concepts.description: The process of checking that new values are valid before setting them in setter methods.

concepts.name: State Encapsulation
concepts.description: The principle of controlling access to and modification of an object's internal state through methods.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variables
concepts.description: Internal class attributes prefixed with underscore to indicate they should not be accessed directly from outside the class.

concepts.name: Property Decorator
concepts.description: Python decorator that allows methods to be accessed like attributes while maintaining encapsulation.

concepts.name: Getter Method
concepts.description: A method that provides controlled access to retrieve private attribute values without exposing internal implementation.

concepts.name: Setter Method
concepts.description: A method that provides controlled access to modify private attribute values with validation or constraints.

concepts.name: State Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing how object state is internally stored and managed from external code.

concepts.name: Public Interface
concepts.description: The exposed methods and properties that external code can use to interact with a class without knowing internal details.

concepts.name: Implementation Independence
concepts.description: The principle that client code should not depend on specific internal implementation details of a class.

concepts.name: Dynamic Value Lookup
concepts.description: The ability to retrieve values from external sources like databases rather than stored instance variables.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The object-oriented principle of bundling data and methods together while restricting direct access to internal components.

concepts.name: Input Validation
concepts.description: The practice of checking and constraining input values in setter methods to maintain object integrity.

concepts.name: Hidden State Implementation
concepts.description: The practice of concealing how a class internally stores and manages its data from external code.

concepts.name: Getter Methods
concepts.description: Public methods that provide controlled read access to an object's private attributes.

concepts.name: Setter Methods
concepts.description: Public methods that provide controlled write access to an object's private attributes with validation.

concepts.name: Read Only Properties
concepts.description: Object attributes that can be accessed but not modified directly from outside the class.

concepts.name: Runtime Validation
concepts.description: The process of checking parameter values at execution time to prevent invalid object states.

concepts.name: Defensive Programming
concepts.description: A programming approach that anticipates and guards against potential errors and invalid inputs.

concepts.name: State Corruption Prevention
concepts.description: Mechanisms to prevent objects from being placed into invalid or inconsistent states.

concepts.name: Dynamic Implementation
concepts.description: The ability to change how methods work internally without affecting their external interface.

concepts.name: Property Decorator
concepts.description: Python syntax using decorators like @property and @price.setter to create controlled attribute access.

concepts.name: Interface Stability
concepts.description: Maintaining consistent method signatures and behavior while allowing internal implementation changes.

concepts.name: Assert Statement
concepts.description: A runtime validation mechanism that aborts program execution with an error message when a condition is false.

concepts.name: Getter Methods
concepts.description: Methods that provide controlled access to retrieve private instance variable values.

concepts.description: Methods that provide controlled access to modify private instance variable values with validation.

concepts.name: Implicit Method Calls
concepts.description: Automatic invocation of getter and setter methods when accessing object properties.

concepts.name: Runtime Error
concepts.description: An error that occurs during program execution, causing the program to terminate abnormally.

concepts.name: Public Method Signatures
concepts.description: The interface definition of methods that external code can call, including method names and parameters.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variables
concepts.description: Internal object data members that are hidden from external access and manipulation.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal class details while exposing only necessary public interfaces.

concepts.name: State Encapsulation
concepts.description: The technique of protecting object state by controlling access through defined methods.

concepts.name: Class Interface Stability

concepts.name: Input Validation

concepts.name: Private Instance Variables
concepts.description: Internal data members of a class that are not directly accessible from outside the class, used to store object state.

concepts.name: Data Encapsulation

concepts.description: The principle of concealing internal implementation details while exposing only necessary public interfaces.

concepts.name: Object State

concepts.description: A method that modifies the value of a private attribute, often with validation logic.

concepts.name: Property Decorator

concepts.name: Invalid Object State
concepts.description: A condition where an object's internal data represents an impossible or inconsistent state.

concepts.name: Data Validation
concepts.description: The process of checking input parameters to ensure they meet required constraints before assignment.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variable

concepts.description: A design flaw where setter methods can put objects into invalid states by allowing partial updates.

concepts.name: Comprehensive Validation

concepts.name: Invalid State Prevention

concepts.name: Defensive Programming
concepts.description: A programming practice that involves writing code to handle unexpected inputs and prevent errors.

concepts.description: The design approach for creating methods that modify object properties safely and correctly.

concepts.name: Private Member Variables

concepts.name: Atomic State Modification

concepts.name: Law Of Demeter
concepts.description: A design guideline that prescribes rules for method calls between objects to maintain loose coupling.

concepts.name: Principle Of Least Knowledge
concepts.description: A design principle stating that objects should have limited knowledge about other objects.

concepts.name: Loose Coupling
concepts.description: A design approach where classes have minimal dependencies on each other's internal implementations.

concepts.name: Method Call Rules
concepts.description: Specific guidelines that determine when one class method can legitimately call another class method.

concepts.name: Object Aggregation
concepts.description: A relationship where one class contains instance variables that reference objects of another class.

concepts.name: Method Chaining Restrictions
concepts.description: Limitations on calling methods on objects returned by other method calls to maintain proper coupling.

concepts.name: Law Of Demeter
concepts.description: A principle stating that a class should only call methods of objects that are close to it.

concepts.name: Method Chaining
concepts.description: The practice of calling methods on objects returned by other method calls, which can violate the Law of Demeter.

concepts.name: Class Dependencies
concepts.description: The relationships and connections between classes that should be minimized for better design.

concepts.name: Object Proximity
concepts.description: The concept of how 'close' objects are to each other in terms of direct relationships and access.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal implementation details from external access to maintain encapsulation.

concepts.description: Methods that provide controlled access to private object attributes, often implemented as properties.

concepts.description: Class methods that belong to the class rather than instances and can be called without creating an object.

concepts.name: Encapsulation Pattern
concepts.description: A design pattern that bundles data and methods together while hiding internal implementation details from external access.

concepts.name: Open-Closed Principle
concepts.description: A design principle that allows classes to be closed for modification but open for extension through inheritance.

concepts.name: Private Methods
concepts.description: Methods that are not accessible from outside the class, indicated by underlined names in UML diagrams.

concepts.name: Static Methods
concepts.description: Methods that belong to the class rather than instances, indicated by underlining in class diagrams.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal implementation details from external code through encapsulation.

concepts.name: Inheritance
concepts.description: A mechanism where subclasses extend superclasses to inherit common attributes and behaviors.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variables
concepts.description: Class attributes that are hidden from external access, typically prefixed with underscores in Python.

concepts.name: Abstract Methods
concepts.description: Methods declared without implementation that must be overridden by subclasses.

concepts.name: Property Decorators
concepts.description: Python decorators that allow methods to be accessed like attributes while maintaining encapsulation.

concepts.name: Superclass
concepts.description: The parent class that provides common attributes and behaviors to its subclasses.

concepts.name: Subclass Extension
concepts.description: The process of creating specialized classes that inherit from and add to a base class.

concepts.name: Code Stability
concepts.description: The ability to maintain existing code without modification while allowing new functionality through extension.

concepts.name: Abstract Method
concepts.description: A method declared in a superclass that must be implemented by subclasses.

concepts.name: Private Instance Variable
concepts.description: A class attribute prefixed with underscore to indicate internal implementation details.

concepts.name: Inheritance Hierarchy
concepts.description: A parent-child relationship structure where subclasses extend a superclass.

concepts.name: Method Overriding
concepts.description: A subclass providing a specific implementation of a method defined in its superclass.

concepts.name: Constructor Chaining
concepts.description: A subclass constructor calling the superclass constructor using super().

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: The practice of keeping internal state and implementation details hidden from external access.

concepts.name: Protected Method
concepts.description: A method prefixed with underscore to indicate it's intended for internal class use.

concepts.name: Polymorphism
concepts.description: The ability for different subclasses to implement the same interface in different ways.

concepts.name: Template Method Pattern
concepts.description: A design pattern where a superclass defines common behavior while subclasses implement specific steps.

concepts.name: State Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of keeping object state variables private to prevent external modification.

concepts.name: Open Closed Principle
concepts.description: Software entities should be open for extension but closed for modification.

concepts.name: Abstract Methods
concepts.description: Methods declared in a superclass that must be implemented by subclasses.

concepts.name: Subclass Implementation
concepts.description: The process of providing concrete implementations for abstract methods in derived classes.

concepts.name: Hidden State Implementation
concepts.description: Private instance variables that encapsulate internal data and are not directly accessible from outside the class.

concepts.name: Hidden Behavior Implementation
concepts.description: Private methods that encapsulate internal functionality and are not exposed to external classes.

concepts.name: Superclass Initialization
concepts.description: The process of invoking the parent class constructor to initialize inherited state.

concepts.name: Extended State
concepts.description: Additional instance variables that subclasses add beyond what is inherited from the superclass.

concepts.name: Extended Behavior
concepts.description: Additional methods that subclasses implement beyond what is inherited from the superclass.

concepts.name: Common State Hiding
concepts.description: The encapsulation of shared attributes in the superclass that are hidden from external access.

concepts.name: Common Behavior Hiding
concepts.description: The encapsulation of shared methods in the superclass that are hidden from external access.

concepts.name: Polymorphic Interface
concepts.description: Public methods that provide a consistent interface across different subclass implementations.

concepts.name: Abstract Method Implementation
concepts.description: The concrete implementation of abstract methods defined in a superclass by subclasses.

concepts.name: Subclass Extension
concepts.description: The ability of subclasses to extend and customize behavior inherited from a superclass.

concepts.name: Implementation Hiding
concepts.description: The practice of concealing internal implementation details from external code.

concepts.name: Private Naming Convention
concepts.description: Python convention using underscore prefix to indicate private variables and methods.

concepts.name: Encapsulation
concepts.description: Object-oriented principle of bundling data and methods while hiding internal state.

concepts.name: Code Stability
concepts.description: The quality of code that remains unchanged and reliable by locking core implementations.

concepts.name: Dependency Minimization
concepts.description: Reducing external reliance on a class's internal implementation details.

concepts.name: Polymorphic Behavior
concepts.description: Different classes implementing the same interface with class-specific behavior.

concepts.name: Superclass Core Implementation
concepts.description: Common functionality implemented in a parent class that is shared by subclasses.

concepts.name: Implementation Refactoring
concepts.description: The ability to improve internal implementation without affecting external code.

concepts.name: Implementation Encapsulation
concepts.description: The practice of hiding class implementation details so that refactoring can occur without affecting client code.

concepts.name: Property Access Control
concepts.description: Using properties to provide controlled access to hidden object state without revealing implementation details.

concepts.name: Property Setter Validation
concepts.description: The requirement that property setters must never allow an object to be put into an invalid state.

concepts.name: Immutable Class
concepts.description: A class that creates objects which cannot be modified after construction.

concepts.name: Reference Exposure Prevention
concepts.description: The practice of not providing references to hidden state implementation to maintain immutability.

concepts.name: Lazy Evaluation Principle
concepts.description: A performance optimization principle that delays expensive calculations until their results are actually needed.

concepts.name: Law of Demeter
concepts.description: A design principle that prescribes rules to minimize problematic dependencies between classes by restricting method calls.

concepts.name: Open-Closed Principle
concepts.description: A design principle stating that classes should be closed for modification but open for extension through inheritance.

concepts.name: State Encapsulation
concepts.description: The hiding of object internal state from external access while providing controlled interfaces.

concepts.name: Code Stability
concepts.description: The quality of code that remains unchanged when implementation details are modified or extended.

concepts.name: Method Call Restrictions
concepts.description: Rules governing which objects a method can call methods on based on relationship types like aggregation or parameter passing.

concepts.name: Inheritance Encapsulation
concepts.description: The use of superclasses to hide and encapsulate common implementation details shared by subclasses.

concepts.name: State Inheritance
concepts.description: The mechanism by which subclasses inherit state attributes from their parent classes.

concepts.name: Behavior Inheritance
concepts.description: The process of subclasses inheriting methods and behavioral characteristics from their parent classes.

concepts.name: Subclass
concepts.description: A class that inherits properties and methods from a parent or superclass.

concepts.name: Code Stability
concepts.description: The principle that software code remains reliable and consistent over time through proper design patterns.

concepts.name: Inheritance Principle
concepts.description: A fundamental object-oriented programming concept that allows classes to inherit characteristics from other classes.

rules.text: Make every instance variable and method private (or protected) except those that must be public to enable other code to use the class.
Once public, always public - if you make an instance variable or method public, you might not be able to change it to private later without forcing code rewrites.
Hide implementation by starting names of instance variables and methods with an underscore (_) to specify that they're private.
Code outside a class should not reference private variables or call private methods (those starting with underscore), nor depend on their particular implementations.
Class A should know as little as possible about the implementation of class B to minimize dependencies.
A class should expose only as much of itself as necessary for other code to use the class, hiding the rest.
Use public getter and setter methods to provide access to private instance variables while maintaining encapsulation.
